marketNews.title: BI Holds Interest Rate, Predicts Fed Funds Rate Down 50 Bps in 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia on Wednesday (21/8) decided to keep the benchmark BI Rate at 6.25%, with the deposit facility and lending facility also maintained at 5.5% and 7% respectively. The decision was in line with consensus expectations. Governor Perry Warjiyo said the decision aligns with the strategy to further strengthen the stabilization of the rupiah exchange rate in Q3 2024. He also noted that the central bank remains open to the possibility of cutting the BI Rate in Q4 2024. Perry said Bank Indonesia forecasts that the U.S. central bank, the Federal Reserve, will carry out two cuts to the Fed Funds Rate (FFR) totaling -50 basis points by the end of 2024. By comparison, the consensus of economists surveyed by Bloomberg expects the Fed to cut rates by -75 basis points by the end of 2024. As expectations of Fed cuts rise, Indonesia's bond and equity markets have seen inflows of IDR 23.7 trillion and IDR 6.6 trillion respectively since the beginning of August 2024. The return of foreign funds to the Indonesian capital market also pushed the rupiah against the U.S. dollar up 4.8% month-to-date to a level of 15,485 per 21 August 2024. Key Takeaway: The recent significant strengthening of the rupiah gives Bank Indonesia more room to start cutting rates, although it appears likely to wait for the Fed’s cuts first. As previously noted in Stockbit Commentary, the prospect of rate cuts and a stronger rupiah will provide positive sentiment for the property and consumer sectors. Several property and consumer stocks have rallied strongly over the past month, including $PWON (+11.9%), $SMRA (+14.29%), $ICBP (+6.02%) and $INDF (+9.05%).

marketNews.title: Government Plans to Increase Public Ownership in BRIS
marketNews.content:
- $BRIS: Deputy State-Owned Enterprises Minister Kartika Wirjoatmodjo told Investor Daily that the government now plans to increase the public ownership share in Bank Syariah Indonesia, considering that no strategic investor candidate is expected to enter BRIS. Meanwhile, BRIS President Director Hery Gunardi declined to comment on rumors of a rights issue to raise the public ownership share. Previously, the State-Owned Enterprises Ministry planned to reduce the holdings of Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI) in BRIS, which currently hold 23.24% and 15.38% respectively.
- $MCAS: M Cash Integrasi plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 30.1 million shares, representing 3.5% of its paid-up capital, between 26 September 2024 and 25 September 2025. The total allocation for the buyback is IDR 90.7 billion, with a maximum buyback price of IDR 3,000 per share.
- $KPIG: MNC Land submitted an objection to the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) regarding the temporary suspension of trading that began on 20 August 2024. KPIG management stated that the company does not meet the suspension conditions set out in the exchange regulations and could not find any reference used by BEI to halt trading. BEI announced that the suspension was due to a significant rise in the share price and was intended as protection for investors.
- $BJTM: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur announced that it has made a capital participation of IDR 100 billion to PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Nusa Tenggara Barat Syariah. The transaction is intended to form a banking business group (KUB) between BJTM and Bank NTB Syariah. After the transaction, the financial statements of Bank NTB Syariah will be consolidated into BJTM.
- $MYOR: Mayora Indah President Director Andre Sukendra Atmadja bought 450,000 MYOR shares at an average price of IDR 2,685.6 per share between 16-19 August 2024. The total transaction value was approximately IDR 1.21 billion. After the transaction, Andre Sukendra Atmadja’s ownership in MYOR increased from 0.009% to 0.011%.
- $BDKR: Director of Berdikari Pondasi Perkasa Tan Franciscus bought 7.1 million BDKR shares at an average price of IDR 765 per share on 15 August 2024. The total transaction value was IDR 5.4 billion. After the transaction, Tan Franciscus’s ownership in BDKR rose from 0.45% to 0.6%.
- $BPII: Batavia Prosperindo Internasional announced that it has increased paid-up capital by approximately SGD 1.7 million (about IDR 20 billion) to its subsidiary Batavia Prosperindo Pte. Ltd. In addition, BPII plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 45 billion, or IDR 4.55 per share, indicating a dividend yield of 0.9% as of Wednesday (21/8). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 29 August 2024, with payment on 20 September 2024.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Credit Growth in 7M24
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that bank credit disbursement grew 12.4% year-on-year during the first seven months of 2024 (versus 12.36% YoY in the first half of 2024). Credit growth was mainly driven by investment credit (+15.2% YoY), working-capital credit (+11.6% YoY) and consumer credit (+10.98% YoY). Meanwhile, Sharia financing grew 11.75% YoY during 7M24 and MSME credit grew 5.16% YoY. Bank Indonesia projects that credit growth in 2024 will stay at the upper end of the target range of 10-12%.

marketNews.title: DPR Annuls Constitutional Court Decision on Regional Election Threshold
marketNews.content: The legislative body (DPR) reported that it decided to annul the Constitutional Court ruling concerning the threshold requirement for candidacy in regional elections (pilkada). The decision is listed in the inventory of issues (DIM) for the Regional Election Bill that was discussed on Wednesday (21/8). The plan is to submit the DIM for the Regional Election Bill to the plenary session on Thursday (22/8). If the legislative body’s decision is approved in the plenary session, the Democratic Party (PDIP) will be unable to submit a regional head candidate in the Jakarta 2024 regional election and several other regions.

marketNews.title: DPR Rejects Constitutional Court Ruling on Age Requirement for Regional Heads
marketNews.content: CNN Indonesia reported that the legislative body (DPR) decided to annul the Constitutional Court ruling that required the age of regional head candidates to be calculated at the time of candidate pair registration. The decision is listed in the inventory of issues (DIM) for the Regional Election Bill that was discussed on Wednesday (21/8). The plan is to submit the DIM for the Regional Election Bill to the plenary session on Thursday (22/8). If the legislative body’s decision is approved in the plenary session, Kaesang Pangarep – the son of President Joko Widodo who is rumored to be nominated by the Indonesia Maju coalition as a vice-governor candidate for Central Java – will be able to participate in the regional election.

marketNews.title: Golkar Appoints Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia as Party Chairman
marketNews.content: The Golkar Party officially appointed the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, as its chairman for the 2024-2029 period on Wednesday (21/8). Four anonymous sources from Golkar told Reuters that Bahlil’s appointment could help President Joko Widodo secure his legacy after the anticipated administration of Prabowo Subianto. The Presidential Staff Office has not responded to requests for comment on the issue.

marketNews.title: Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan Says Airline Ticket Price Reduction to Be Completed in August 2024
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, said that the process of reducing airline ticket prices will be completed in August 2024. Luhut mentioned that the National Air Ticket Price Supervision Committee is considering several factors to lower ticket prices, including opening the market to other suppliers of aviation turbine fuel (avtur) for domestic airlines. Luhut noted that avtur supply is currently provided by Pertamina, making avtur prices uncompetitive.

marketNews.title: Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan Says Government Plans to Shut 2 GW of Suralaya Coal Power Plant
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, said that the government plans to shut down 2 gigawatts of capacity at the Suralaya coal-fire power plant in Banten to address air pollution in Jakarta. The Suralaya plant, owned by PLN, has a total capacity of 4 gigawatts. Meanwhile, PLN intends to add 2 gigawatts to the complex by developing a more modern coal-fire plant through a joint venture with Barito Pacific ($BRPT) and PT Indo Raya Tenaga. The new electricity facility is targeted to be operational by the end of August 2024.

marketNews.title: Special Staff of BUMN Minister Says Waiting for New Administration Before BUMN Mergers and IPOs
marketNews.content: The Special Staff of the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Arya Sinulingga, said that his office is waiting for the transition to a new administration before carrying out BUMN corporate actions such as mergers and IPOs. Arya also mentioned that the formation of a BUMN Karya holding is expected to be realized in October 2024. Previously, the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, said that he could not determine when the BUMN Karya holding would be completed because the policy is still awaiting review from the Ministry of Public Works and Housing.
